C005.name: Single Responsibility Principle
C005.description: Each function should do one thing only

C019.name: Log Level Usage
C019.description: Không sử dụng log mức error cho lỗi không nghiêm trọng

C020.name: Unused Imports
C020.description: Không import các module hoặc symbol không sử dụng

C021.name: Import Organization
C021.description: Tổ chức và sắp xếp imports theo nhóm và thứ tự alphabet

C006.name: Function Naming Convention
C006.description: Tên hàm phải là động từ/verb-noun pattern

C007.name: Meaningful Comments
C007.description: Avoid comments that just describe the code

C008.name: Minimize Variable Scope - Declare Near Usage
C008.description: Variables should be declared as close as possible to where they are first used

C010.name: Limit Block Nesting
C010.description: Limit nested blocks (if/for/while/switch) to maximum 3 levels for readability

C013.name: No Dead Code
C013.description: Detect and remove commented out code, unused variables/functions, and unreachable code

C012.name: Command Query Separation
C012.description: Separate Command and Query operations (CQS principle)

C015.name: Domain Language
C015.description: Use domain language in class/function names

C018.name: Do not throw generic errors
C018.description: Always provide detailed messages and context.

C023.name: Do not declare duplicate variable
C023.description: Do not declare duplicate variable names in the same scope

C024.name: Do not scatter hardcoded constants throughout the logic
C024.description: The rule prevents scattering hardcoded constants throughout the logic. Instead, constants should be defined in a single place to improve maintainability and readability.

C029.name: Catch Block Error Logging
C029.description: Mọi catch block phải log nguyên nhân lỗi đầy đủ

C031.name: Validation Logic Separation
C031.description: Logic kiểm tra dữ liệu (validate) phải nằm riêng biệt

C032.name: No External APIs in Constructors
C032.description: Don't call external APIs in constructors or static blocks

C033.name: Separate Processing Logic and Data Queries
C033.description: Separate processing logic and data queries in service layer

C034.name: Limit Direct Access to Global State
C034.description: Limit direct access to global state in domain logic

C035.name: Log all relevant context when handling errors
C035.description: When handling errors, must log full information related - structured logging with context

C037.name: Standard Response Objects
C037.description: API handlers should return standard response objects (not raw strings)

C038.name: No File Loading Order Dependency
C038.description: Avoid logic depending on file/module loading order

C040.name: Centralized Validation Logic
C040.description: Don't scatter validation logic across multiple classes

C041.name: Do not hardcode or push sensitive information (token, API key, secret, URL) into the repo
C041.description: Protect sensitive application data, avoid security risks, and comply with security standards. Exposing sensitive information can lead to serious security and privacy issues.

C043.name: No Console Or Print
C043.description: Do not use console.log or print in production code

C060.name: Do not override superclass methods and ignore critical logic
C060.description: Preserve important behavior or lifecycle logic defined in the superclass to ensure correctness and prevent silent errors.

S001.name: Fail Securely
S001.description: Verify that if there is an error in access control, the system fails securely

S003.name: Open Redirect Protection
S003.description: URL redirects must validate against an allow list to prevent open redirect vulnerabilities

S004.name: Sensitive Data Logging Protection
S004.description: Prevent logging of sensitive information like passwords, tokens, and payment data without proper redaction

metadata.owaspCategory: A09:2021 - Security Logging and Monitoring Failures

S005.name: No Origin Header Authentication
S005.description: Do not use Origin header for authentication/access control

S006.name: No Plaintext Recovery/Activation Codes
S006.description: Do not send recovery or activation codes in plaintext

S007.name: No Plaintext OTP
S007.description: One-Time Passwords must not be stored in plaintext

S008.name: Crypto Agility
S008.description: Ensure cryptographic agility and algorithm flexibility

S009.name: No Insecure Crypto
S009.description: Prevent usage of insecure cryptographic methods

S010.name: No Insecure Random in Sensitive Context
S010.description: Prevent insecure random generator usage in sensitive contexts

S011.name: No Insecure UUID
S011.description: UUID must be version 4 and use CSPRNG

S012.name: Hardcoded Secrets Protection
S012.description: Detects hardcoded secrets, API keys, passwords, tokens, and credentials in source code to prevent accidental exposure through version control

S013.name: Verify TLS Connection
S013.description: Verify that TLS connections are properly established and validated

S014.name: Insecure TLS Version
S014.description: Prevent usage of insecure TLS versions

S015.name: Insecure TLS Certificate
S015.description: Prevent usage of insecure TLS certificate configurations

S016.name: Sensitive Query Parameter
S016.description: Prevent sensitive data in URL query parameters

S019.name: SMTP Injection Protection
S019.description: Detects potential SMTP/IMAP injection vulnerabilities by identifying unsanitized user input in email fields and direct SMTP protocol manipulation

S020.name: Avoid using eval() or executing dynamic code
S020.description: Avoid using eval() or executing dynamic code as it can lead to code injection vulnerabilities and compromise application security.

S030.name: Disable directory browsing and protect sensitive metadata files
S030.description: Disable directory browsing and protect sensitive metadata files (.git/, .env, config files, etc.) to prevent information disclosure and potential security vulnerabilities.

S022.name: Output Encoding Required
S022.description: Require output encoding for user input

S024.name: Protect against XPath Injection and XML External Entity (XXE)
S024.description: Protect against XPath Injection and XML External Entity (XXE) attacks. XPath injection occurs when user input is used to construct XPath queries without proper sanitization. XXE attacks exploit XML parsers that process external entities, potentially leading to data disclosure, server-side request forgery, or denial of service.

S025.name: Always validate client-side data on the server
S025.description: Ensure all client-side data is validated on the server. Client-side validation is not sufficient for security as it can be bypassed by attackers. Server-side validation is mandatory for data integrity and security.

S028.name: Limit upload file size and number of files per user
S028.description: File uploads must enforce size limits and file quantity limits to prevent resource exhaustion and DoS attacks. Both file size and number of files should be limited at the server-side.

S029.name: Require CSRF Protection
S029.description: Require CSRF protection for state-changing operations

S031.name: Set Secure flag for Session Cookies
S031.description: Set Secure flag for Session Cookies to protect via HTTPS. This ensures cookies are only transmitted over secure connections, preventing interception.

S032.name: Set HttpOnly attribute for Session Cookies
S032.description: Set HttpOnly attribute for Session Cookies to prevent JavaScript access. This protects against XSS attacks by preventing client-side script access to sensitive cookies.

S033.name: Set SameSite attribute for Session Cookies
S033.description: Set SameSite attribute for Session Cookies to reduce CSRF risk. This prevents the browser from sending cookies along with cross-site requests, mitigating CSRF attacks.

S034.name: Use __Host- prefix for Session Cookies
S034.description: Use __Host- prefix for Session Cookies to prevent subdomain sharing. The __Host- prefix ensures cookies are only sent to the exact domain that set them, preventing subdomain cookie sharing attacks.

S035.name: Set Path attribute for Session Cookies
S035.description: Set Path attribute for Session Cookies to limit access scope

S037.name: Configure comprehensive cache headers to prevent sensitive data leakage
S037.description: Configure comprehensive cache headers (Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, Pragma: no-cache, Expires: 0) for sensitive responses to avoid caching sensitive data in browsers or intermediaries.

S038.name: Do not expose version information in response headers
S038.description: Prevent exposure of server version information through response headers (Server, X-Powered-By, X-AspNet-Version, etc.) to reduce information disclosure and potential attack vectors.

S039.name: Do not pass Session Tokens via URL parameters
S039.description: Detects when session tokens, authentication tokens, JWT tokens, or other sensitive authentication data are passed as URL parameters instead of secure headers or request body. URL parameters are logged in web server logs, browser history, and can be exposed in referrer headers.

S041.name: Session Tokens must be invalidated after logout or expiration
S041.description: Session tokens must be properly invalidated after logout or expiration to prevent session hijacking and unauthorized access. This includes clearing session data, invalidating JWT tokens, and ensuring proper session cleanup.

S042.name: Require Periodic Reauthentication
S042.description: Require periodic re-authentication for sensitive operations

S043.name: Terminate Sessions on Password Change
S043.description: Terminate all sessions when password changes

S044.name: Re-authentication Required for Sensitive Operations
S044.description: Require re-authentication before performing sensitive operations such as password changes, email changes, profile updates, and other critical account modifications. This prevents unauthorized access to sensitive account functions even if a session is compromised.

S045.name: Brute-force Protection
S045.description: Implement protection against brute-force attacks on authentication endpoints. This rule detects missing rate limiting, account lockout mechanisms, and other brute-force protection measures in authentication flows.

S046.name: Secure Notification on Auth Change
S046.description: Require secure notification on authentication changes

S047.name: Secure Random Password Generation
S047.description: Require secure and random initial password generation

S049.name: Authentication tokens should have short validity periods
S049.description: Authentication tokens (JWT, session tokens, etc.) should have appropriately short validity periods to minimize the risk of token compromise. Long-lived tokens increase the attack surface and potential impact of token theft.

S050.name: Session Token Weak Hash
S050.description: Prevent weak hashing for session tokens

S051.name: Password length policy enforcement (12-64 chars recommended, reject >128)
S051.description: Enforce strong password length policies with multi-signal detection. Prevent weak validators, missing limits, and FE/BE mismatches.

C065.name: One Behavior per Test (AAA Pattern)
C065.description: Enforce single behavior testing - each test should verify exactly one action/behavior with clear Arrange-Act-Assert structure

S052.name: OTP must have ≥20-bit entropy (≥6 digits) and use CSPRNG
S052.description: Prevent guessable OTP by enforcing CSPRNG and minimal entropy. Ban non-crypto RNG and too-short codes.

S054.name: Disallow Default/Built-in Accounts (admin/root/sa/...)
S054.description: Prevent use of default or shared accounts. Enforce per-user identities, initial password change, and disabling well-known built-ins.

S055.name: REST Content-Type Verification
S055.description: Verify incoming Content-Type in REST API endpoints

S056.name: Protect against Log Injection attacks
S056.description: Protect against Log Injection attacks. Log injection occurs when user-controlled data is written to log files without proper sanitization, potentially allowing attackers to manipulate log entries, inject malicious content, or exploit log processing systems.

S057.name: Log with UTC Timestamps
S057.description: Ensure all logs use synchronized UTC time with ISO 8601/RFC3339 format to avoid timezone discrepancies across systems

S058.name: No SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery)
S058.description: Prevent SSRF attacks by validating URLs from user input before making HTTP requests

C002.name: Rule C002
C002.description: Auto-migrated rule C002 from ESLint mapping

C003.name: Rule C003
C003.description: Auto-migrated rule C003 from ESLint mapping

C014.name: Dependency Injection Pattern
C014.description: Use Dependency Injection instead of direct instantiation in business logic. Increases testability and reduces coupling.

ast.description: C014 requires symbol-based analysis for accurate dependency injection pattern detection

C017.name: Rule C017
C017.description: Auto-migrated rule C017 from ESLint mapping

C030.name: Rule C030
C030.description: Auto-migrated rule C030 from ESLint mapping

C042.name: Rule C042
C042.description: Auto-migrated rule C042 from ESLint mapping

C047.name: Rule C047
C047.description: Auto-migrated rule C047 from ESLint mapping

C048.name: Do not bypass architectural layers (controller/service/repository)
C048.description: Maintain a clear layered architecture, ensuring logic and data flow are well-structured and maintainable.

C052.name: Parsing or data transformation logic must be separated from controllers
C052.description: Enforce separation of concerns — controllers should only handle requests and delegate processing, improving testability, maintainability, and reuse.

C067.name: No Hardcoded Configuration
C067.description: Improve configurability, reduce risk when changing environments, and make configuration management flexible and maintainable.

C070.name: No Real Time Tests
C070.description: Tests should not depend on real time delays or sleeps. Use fake timers, clock injection, or condition-based waits to improve test reliability and speed.

C072.name: Single Test Behavior
C072.description: Each test should assert only one behavior

C073.name: Validate Required Configuration on Startup
C073.description: C073 - Validate mandatory configuration at startup and fail fast on invalid/missing values

C075.name: Rule C075
C075.description: Auto-migrated rule C075 from ESLint mapping

C076.name: Explicit Function Argument Types
C076.description: All public functions must declare explicit types for arguments
